[40, 50]
Listing 9.55: Example output from the ﬁrst sample.
The split sequence() function below implements this behavior and will split a given
univariate time series into samples with a speciﬁed number of input and output time steps.
# split a univariate sequence into samples
def split_sequence(sequence, n_steps_in, n_steps_out):
X, y = list(), list()
for i in range(len(sequence)):
# find the end of this pattern
end_ix = i + n_steps_in
out_end_ix = end_ix + n_steps_out
